The BCBT was carried out as previously described with minor modification.
16 A solution of 0.5 mg β-carotene (type I synthetic; Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, USA) in 1 mL chloroform was prepared in a flask. Then 25 µL linoleic acid (Sigma-Aldrich) and 400 mg Tween 40 (Sigma-Aldrich) were added into the flask. The chloroform was removed completely using a rotary evaporator (Model 4003; Heidolph Laborata, Schwabach, Germany) at 40 ˚C and then 100 mL of distilled water was added and shaken vigorously. Aliquots 2.5 mL of this emulsion were transferred into a series of test tubes containing 350 μL of various concentrations (1.0, 2.5, 5.0 and 10 mg mL -1) of the EOs. The same procedure was repeated with butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT) and ascorbic acid as reference antioxidants along with a blank. The absorbance of each tube was measured at 470 nm immediately at zero time and also after a two-hour period while the tubes were kept in a water bath at 50˚C.
